sentences.en: A green valley opened up before us.
sentences.cn: 青翠的山谷展现在我们眼前

sentences.en: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.cn: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.en: an open window
sentences.cn: 打开的窗户

sentences.en: At last the frightened witness opened up and told the truth.
sentences.cn: 这名吓坏了的目击者终于直言不讳说出了事实

sentences.en: Don't leave a child alone in a room with an open fire.
sentences.cn: 房间里有裸露的明火时，不要让孩子独处其中。

sentences.en: During the 1980s the world's financial systems became more open.
sentences.cn: 在20世纪80年代，世界金融体系变得更加开放。

sentences.en: Everyone wanted to bowl, hence everyone wanted to open a bowling alley.
sentences.cn: 大家都想玩保龄球，因此大家都想开保龄球馆。

sentences.en: He opened the drawer of the desk.
sentences.cn: 他拉开书桌的抽屉。

sentences.en: he opened up a lead of 14–8.
sentences.cn: 他开了个好头，以14比8领先。

sentences.en: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.cn: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.en: He was very open in his attitudes about sex.
sentences.cn: 他对待性的态度非常开放。

sentences.en: His mouth was a little open, as if he'd started to scream.
sentences.cn: 他的嘴微微张开,似乎是要开始尖叫.

sentences.en: I had always been completely open with my mother.
sentences.cn: 我一直在妈妈面前知无不言。

sentences.en: I went into the job with my eyes open—everyone knows what happens to an unsuccessful manager.
sentences.cn: 我睁大眼睛开始了工作——每个人都知道失败的经理会有什么下场。

sentences.en: I went into the job with my eyes open—everyone knows what happens to an unsuccessful manager.
sentences.cn: 我睁大眼睛开始了工作——每个人都知道失败的经理会有什么下场。

sentences.en: In the same instant he flung open the car door.
sentences.cn: 与此同时，他猛地推开了车门。

sentences.en: Its beautiful gardens and parkland are also open to the public.
sentences.cn: 它漂亮的花园和绿地也向公众开放。

sentences.en: Jack opened the window.
sentences.cn: 杰克打开窗户。

sentences.en: open up new markets.
sentences.cn: 打开了新的市场

sentences.en: Rachel burst out as the door was flung open again.
sentences.cn: 当门被再次猛地推开时，雷切尔冲了出去。

sentences.en: She heard a door open and then close.
sentences.cn: 她听到有扇门开了又关上。

sentences.en: She looked at the open suitcase with surprise.
sentences.cn: 她惊讶地看着打开的手提箱。

sentences.en: The action is an open violation of the Vienna Convention.
sentences.cn: 该行为公然违背了《维也纳公约》。

sentences.en: The artillery opened up at dawn.
sentences.cn: 炮兵于拂晓时开口

sentences.en: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.cn: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.en: The farm is open to the public only during two open-house weekends.
sentences.cn: 该农场仅在两个周末接待日才对公众开放。

sentences.en: The forum is now open to all budding entrepreneurs.
sentences.cn: 这个论坛目前向所有企业家新秀敞开大门。

sentences.en: The fridge door was open and food was scattered across the floor.
sentences.cn: 冰箱门开着，食物散落在地板上。

sentences.en: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.cn: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.en: The kitten wormed its way through the just-open door.
sentences.cn: 小猫缩着身子从刚开了一点儿的门中挤过来。

sentences.en: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.cn: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.en: The new store opens up next month.
sentences.cn: 这家新商店将在下个月开张

sentences.en: The surgeon opened up the patient's chest.
sentences.cn: 这名外科医生切开了病人的胸部

sentences.en: There was an open bottle of wine on the table.
sentences.cn: 桌上有一瓶打开的葡萄酒。

sentences.en: They are open to suggestions on how working conditions might be improved.
sentences.cn: 他们愿意就如何改善工作条件听取各种意见。

sentences.en: Whenever I open my mouth I don't half waffle on.
sentences.cn: 我无论何时开口，从不夸夸其谈。

words.tran_cn: [五金] 开启工具；开启的人
开始；机会；通路；空缺的职位
[电]公开的；敞开的；空旷的；坦率的；营业着的

phrases.tran_cn: 在法庭上（面对法官和群众）
开放政策；预定保险单；开口保险单
（运动员，运动队）取得本方的领先
空地；休憩用地；露天场所
完全开放的，大开的；易受攻击的

phrases.phrase: with one's eyes open (或with open eyes)
phrases.tran_cn: 睁大眼睛（充分认识到风险）

trans.tran_cn: 开放的，张开的，通畅的，敞口的，开阔的，敞开的，外露的，公开的，可利用的，有效的，易受损害，坦诚的，未决定的，稀疏的
trans.tran_en: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out

trans.tran_cn: 打开，开启，翻开，睁开，开放，通向，开始营业，准备接待，开幕，召开，开始，开盘，上映
trans.tran_en: to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way
